content: Mods before you count this off as a conspiracy theory, look at the source... "Fuax news" (Fair and balanced) "http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,522217,00.html" "Dr. Yuri Labvin, president of the Tunguska Spatial Phenomenon Foundation, insists that an alien spacecraft sacrificed itself to prevent a gigantic meteor from slamming into the planet above Siberia on June 30, 1908."

content: From what I've read about the Tunguska Event, the fact that it exploded (due to vaporization of internal cavities filled with various ices - nitrogen, oxygen, etc.) created a larger and more devestating event. As a solid meteor, it would have hit created a crater and buried into the earth throwing up dust but centering much of the impact at one point. As only a jet of gasses and smaller solids, it 'diverted' as it reached the earth and fanned out 3000+ degree gasses over a much wider area, causing tremendous devastation. So much for the idea of an alien 'saving' us. If you believe in such things (and if you do, I've got the deed to a bridge that you will just love!) the aliens made it worse. Sullivan013
reply: From what I've read about the Tunguska Event, the fact that it exploded (due to vaporization of internal cavities filled with various ices - nitrogen, oxygen, etc.) created a larger and more devestating event. As only a jet of gasses and smaller solids, it 'diverted' as it reached the earth and fanned out 3000+ degree gasses over a much wider area, causing tremendous devastation. content: CJ sees this as just another reason to trash Fox News. But what makes this story is the messenger, a Russian scientist. If some ordinary schmuch had announced the same thing it would not be newsworthy. It should be noted that Fox also reported the conventional wisdom on this incident. "Most scientists think the blast was caused by a meteorite exploding several miles above the surface." Fox News; fair and balanced as always...
